message: Hi Bob, I'm excited to offer you a fantastic product that I believe you'll find incredibly valuable. Given its worth, I'm proposing an initial price of $11,500.  What are your thoughts?

I appreciate your offer, Alice, but I was thinking more along the lines of $10,500. I'm really interested in the product, but I need to make sure I'm getting a good deal. Can you consider my counteroffer?
Bob, I understand your position, but $10,500 is a bit too low for me.  How about we meet in the middle at $11,000? It's a fair price that reflects the true value of this product.

I understand your concerns, Alice, but I'm still a bit hesitant to go up to $11,000. How about we try to find a compromise at $10,750? I'm willing to meet you halfway, but I really want to make sure I'm getting a good deal.

Bob, I appreciate your willingness to negotiate.  While $10,750 is closer to what I had in mind, I can't accept anything less than $10,900.  This is my final offer, as I believe it's a fair reflection of the product's value.
I understand that $10,900 is your final offer, but I'm still a bit short on budget. I'm willing to go up to $10,800, but that's as high as I can go. Can you meet me at that price?
